comment: Ah, the mid-life crisis starter pack: tighty-whities and a confessional video.
The true villain of the series: veggie bacon.
Pay attention, class. This is the thesis statement for the entire show.
Nothing fuels a villain arc like being humiliated by a teenager named Chad.
Hank's entire personality is 'what if a monster truck became a person?'
This is your cue to laugh 🤣
Translation: 'You're smart but you're a wimp.' Thanks, Hank.
And at this moment, a PowerPoint of bad ideas began in Walt's head.
Narrator: He would, in fact, get a little excitement in his life.
Well, that certainly escalated from a persistent cough.
My man gets a death sentence and he's worried about mustard. Priorities.
And thus, the 'I am the danger' era began. With eyebrows.
Cap'n Cook. Not the most subtle drug kingpin name, is it?
Just a casual correction from a guy who *definitely* isn't taking notes.
Pinkman! The C- student who's about to become an A+ business partner.
The world's most awkward and menacing job interview.
Mr. White using 'the teacher voice' for evil. It's surprisingly effective.
Even when breaking bad, he can't resist a teachable moment.
And their beautiful, dysfunctional partnership begins.
HE SAID THE THING! EVERYBODY DRINK!
Ah, the 'I have cancer and am becoming a criminal mastermind' glow-up.
Heisenberg beta test 1.0 is a resounding success.
Never forget that this man is 50% of the criminal enterprise.
The official uniform of meth-cooking. It's for... ventilation.
Find someone who looks at you the way Jesse looks at 99.1% pure meth.
Rule #1 of Breaking Bad Club: Don't get high on your own supply.
Ah, the classic 'bring my recently arrested cousin to a drug deal' maneuver.
When in doubt, offer free chemistry lessons.
The one time you DON'T want a smoke break.
See? Chemistry class IS useful after all.
Nothing spices up a marriage like a little light murder.
